name: Gramborough Hill and Salthouse Circular Walk, Blakeney

ai.summary: A challenging coastal circular hike near Blakeney, covering 21.1 km with varied terrain including dune paths, marsh boardwalks, grassy tracks, and a climb to Gramborough Hill. Expect exposed coastal winds, sea views, and rich wildlife. Plan for roughly 6–9 hours depending on pace and conditions.
ai.terrain_summary: Mix of coastal footpaths, grassy dune tracks, salt marsh boardwalks, and inland tracks. Expect soft sand in dunes, muddy sections in marshes, and a steep climb to Gramborough Hill. Some stretches may be exposed to wind and weather; watch footing along uneven paths and near water.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times before starting; some sections run along marsh edges that can be cut off by high tide. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and layered clothing for changeable coastal weather. Carry a map and compass or GPS, plus a charged phone and emergency contact. The route includes remote stretches with limited phone signal; inform someone of your plan. Stay aware of wildlife, avoid disturbing birds, and keep to marked paths.
recommended_gear: Map and compass (or GPS) and a charged phone
Whistle and basic first aid kit
Extra warm layer for exposed coastal winds
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) offers the best conditions, though coastal weather can be windy and changeable year-round.

seo.title: Gramborough Hill and Salthouse Circular Walk – 21.1 km Hard Coastal Trek from Blakeney, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Gramborough Hill and Salthouse Circular Walk, a 21.1 km challenging coastal hike near Blakeney, Norfolk. Terrain, safety tips, gear, and best seasons explained.
